title: Luxe Bar wide techno sans
content:
Can anyone help with this sans?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071231133731im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Luxe.jpg)

 [‹ Nada Surf Poster](http://web.archive.org/web/20071231133731/http:/typophile.com/node/18905 "Go to previous forum topic") [MLB.com, mets.com sans serif baseball logos ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071231133731/http:/typophile.com/node/18902 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Aether

comments.content: Dunno LUXE, but BAR is likely a squashed Trebuchet.
knowing that i wonder if its some random font off the internet.

\> Dunno LUXE, but BAR is likely a squashed Trebuchet.

In light of this, LUXE does look like a squashed [Venacti](http://web.archive.org/web/20071231133731/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/venacti/) by Ray Larabie.

However, noting the middle join on E, it could be custom.

I’m almost certain “LUXE” has been built using parts from “Orbit”:  
 [http://vllg.com/Thirstype/Orbit/mudTyper+Weights/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071231133731/http:/vllg.com/Thirstype/Orbit/mudTyper+Weights/)

The Medium lowercase provides the glyphs; the “X” is built by snipping and reassembling the “y”, and the “E” has had a curve inserted in its middle section.
Plus you certainly can’t go wrong with Orbit. You need an exact match?
Thank you all, i can work with that.
